attributes.action: Include Breast feeding women to criteria when testing for potential Coronavirus
attributes.additional_details:
Breastfeeding mums should be tested. The reason behing it is science. Immunity/antibodies is passed from mum to baby when the mums immune system is triggerd. If a breastfeeding mum contracts coronavirus and then recovers her breast milk will include these antibodies naturally to protect her baby/aid her baby to recover if they already have it too. 
Therefore breastmilk may offer antibodies to those most vulnerable now.
attributes.background: Include breastfeeding women in the testing criteria for possible coronavirus.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The conduct of tests is a clinical decision for the NHS, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling for the Governemnt to provide publicly accessible testing for coronavirus around the UK, which you might want to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301354

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
